sect1.title: Internal Component Design

para.heading: The component "ComServer_CL" is splitted into the following subcomponents: ComServer and ComServer_Serialization.

sect1.para:
This subcomponent is responsible for handling the services (offer/request and availability check) based on the specification and initiating notification sending (initial/on change/cyclical/response) for the subscribers.
ComServ: Generated(only .c file, .h file is written by hand). This unit is responsible for requesting and offering the services. It initiates to send notifications cyclically, on change or as a response for a request.
ComServ_SdHandling: Generated. This unit is responsible for managing the state of the requested/offered services and their resourcegroups. It handles the requests and offers with SD.
ComServ_util: Written by hand. Includes functions which are used for signal2service and for service2signal transformation.

This subcomponent is responsible for serializing and deserializing the data according to the SOME/IP protocol and the given specification.
ComServ_cdd_send_gen: Generated. This unit is responsible for building up the skeleton of the notification.
ComServ_SomeIP_payload_gen: Generated. This unit is responsible for generating the payload of the notification.
ComServ_serializing_util: Written by hand. Includes functions which are used during the data serialisation process in order to keep the rules: TAG (WireType+TLV) + DATA
ComServ_cdd_read_gen: Generated. This unit is responsible for deserializing the received data from the server.
ComServ_set_gen: Generated. This unit is responsible for mapping the received data to the corresponding signal and controlling the corresponding routing mechaninsm.

ComServer_CL component is mostly generated. The steps that needs to be followed in order to generate the ComserverQM source files and header files are fully discrebed in the comserv_codegen_manual.docx which is located at https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/blob/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/c/tools/codegen/manual/comserv_codegen_manual.docx . The code generator is located in Git: https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/tree/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/c/tools/codegen Generator overview Diagram The generator uses the following files:

listitem.para: *ServiceSpecification_ComservQM*.xlsx It is the official ServiceSpecification provided by VW in DFL. It determines from ComServer point of view which services should be offered or requested. Furthermore, it describes for every resource group of the services the connection between its signals "signal world" and properties "service world". Determines the calculation method of the property: <MethodName> This file is stored in artifactory and is located in : Chorus_MainLine\sw.sys.chorus_main_build\ mc_sw \ _TPD \ appl\ ComServer \ ComServ \ Evo \ cfg \ ServiceSpecification Because the tool we use needs a slitghtly differently columns order this file it is not used in code generation.

MEB_ICAS1_ServiceSpecification_ComServ.xlsx Because our tool needs an slitghtly differently format to generate the code we have our local ServiceSpecification that we keep it up to date and we are patching it based on the official file. Differences from the official are: This excel file has to be sorted by service and resource name otherwise the generated code will be incorrect or incomplete. New column was introduced "Some/IP" in order to indicate if the signal needs to be implemented/mapped on the service or not. This was introduced because not all the signals present in the oficial ServiceSpecification needs to be implemented. Usually each change (adding/removing new signals) is treated under a specific CR, and this column is used to control when these changes will be implemented. Location in Git : https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/blob/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/Evo/cfg/input/MEB_ICAS1_ServiceSpecification_ComServ.xlsx

*ComServQM_SST_V*.xlsx It is the official file that is provided to us by VW in DFL. It describes the signals: <SignalName>, <PortName>, <SignalGroupName>, <SignalType>, <MappedSignalName>, <MappedPortName>, <Sender>, <Receiver>, <DataType>, , <QueueSize>, <MinPhysical>, <MaxPhysical>, <Unit>, <Resolution>, <Offset>, <StructDatatype>, <BusName>, <MinDigital>, <MaxDigital>,<Timeout>, <InitValue>, <ErrorValue>,<MessageName>, <StartOnEvent>, <EnableUpdate>, <E2E>, <ASIL classification>="">, <Implicit>, <RunnableEntity>, <SwAddrMethod> This official version is stored on artifactory and the location is: Chorus_MainLine\sw.sys.chorus_main_build\ mc_sw \ _TPD \ appl\ ComServer \ ComServ \ Evo \ cfg \ sst

SST_ComServ.xlsx Because our tool for code generation and for RTE needs a different columns order we have our local SST file that we keep it up to date. For the right format we have a tool to generate the local SST.The steps that needs to be followed in order to generate the SST file are fully discrebed in the generate_sst_manual.docx which is located at https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/blob/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/c/tools/generate_sst/manual/generate_sst_manual.docx Tool location : https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/blob/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/c/tools/generate_sst/sst_for_classic.py Location of SST: https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/blob/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/Evo/cfg/input/SST_ComServ.xlsx

ARXML files of the services It is provided by VW. These arxml files describe the structure of the services. The official arxml files are stored on artifactory and the location is: Chorus_MainLine\sw.sys.chorus_main_build\ mc_sw \ _TPD \ appl\ ComServer \ ComServ \ Evo \ cfg \ arxml

services.txt This file is used to pick from service specification the services that are necessary for ComservCL. location in GIT: https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/tree/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/Evo/cfg/input

extraInitialNotification.txt It includes a list of services where the initial notification is triggered separately from service discovery. location in GIT: https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/tree/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/Evo/cfg/input

services_sends_cyclically.txt It includes a list about services which are sent cyclically location in GIT: https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/tree/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/Evo/cfg/input

pdus_to_be_stopped.txt It includes a list about PDUS which should be handled by ComServer_CL location in GIT: https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/tree/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/Evo/cfg/input

extraVLANs.txt It includes a list about services which are sent on the specific VLAN location in GIT: https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/tree/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/Evo/cfg/input

tunnel_transmissions.txt It includes a list about PDUs which are sent through tunnel location in GIT: https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/tree/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/Evo/cfg/input

systemManifests.txt It includes a list about systemManifest files which should be used during generation location in GIT: https://github-vni.geo.conti.de/bs-vw-meb-19-icas1-chorus/sw.sys.chorus_main_doc/tree/master/mc_sw/appl/ComServer/ComServ/Evo/cfg/input The following naming conventions are used:

From the MEB_ICAS1_ServiceSpecification_ComServ.xlsx file:
<SignalName>: name of the signal (column A)
<ServiceName>: name of the service (column I)
<ResourceName>: name of the resourcegroup (column K)
<KommServer>: describes the role of comserv for each service (column H)
KommServer
Rol
C
client
S
server
<Key-Property>: name of the property key for each resource name (column L)
<Some/IP Key Value>: Value of each key property(column M).It can be found also in column D (TLV Data-ID) from each service description file(Service_*.xlsx *).This files can be found in DFL.(column M)
<Property name>="">: Name of the property for each resource.(column O)
<SomeIP parameter>="">: Number for SomeIP Parameter(column R)
<MethodName>: name of the calculation method (column Q)
MethodName
mappedServiceValue
mappedValue
propertyValue
signalValue
staticValue
valueType
<Some/IP>: This column is used exclusivly to indicate if the signal is implemented or not in Comserv. (column U)
Some/IP
Description
x
the signal is implemented
Blank
the signal is not implemented

From the SST_ComServ.xlsx:

<Portname>: name of the port (column B)
<MappedSignalName>: name of the mapped signal name (column D)
<Mapped>: name of the mapped (column E)
<Sender>: name of the bus that sends the signal (column F)
<Receiver>: name of the bus that receivs the signal (column G)

<MinPhysical>: minimum physical value of the signal (column I)
<MaxPhysical>: maximum physical value of the signal (column J)
<Unit>: name of the unit that is used for value of the signal(column K)
<Resolution>: Value of resolution (column L)
<Offset>: Offset value(column M)
<DataType> and the corresponding <ShortSignalType>: type of the signal (column N)

<Offset>: value for timeout(column R)

<ErrorValue>: error value of the signal (column T)(currently not used in generator as per SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1053)

From the ARXML files of the specific service:
<TLVofProperty>: TLV value of the property
<PropertyType> and the corresponding <ShortPropertyType>: type of the property

From pdus_to_be_stopped.txt , tunnel_transmissions.txt:

From services.txt ,extraInitialNotification.txt ,services_sends_cyclically.txt ,tunnel_transmissions.txt:

From systemManifests.txt:
<FileName>: name of the System Manifest files that comserver uses for code generation.

From extraVLANs.txt:
<VlanName> : name of the VLAN
<SignalName> : name of the signal

sect1.title: Requirements Allocation

blockquote.para: The SW requirements are defined in module 5.SWR_ICAS1_ComServ and in chapter 2.23.1 SOME/IP Communication Chorus from SWR_ICAS1_BSW. All the software requirements assigned to ComservCL are satisfied by mentioned subcomponents.

sect1.para:
Non functional requirements are traced here:
Requirement ID
Action
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1236
The ComServ of ICAS1 shall run on Classic Autosar environment.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1498
The CPU load consumed by ComServCL should be maximum 15% @ 180MHz.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1499
The main Function cycle time should be 10ms.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1495
The RAM consumed by ComServCL should be maximum 40KB.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1496
The ROM consumed by ComServCL should be maximum 350KB.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1497
The NVM consumed by ComServCL should be maximum 0.1KB.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1500
The start-up time of the ComServCL should be maximum 200ms.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1069
ComServer_CL shall update service properties and make them available to the service user latest 15 ms after their corresponding changed signals were available at CRoute.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1120
Service calls which lead to sending a signal must be processed after 20ms at the latest.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1076
Service calls which lead to sending a response to the caller must be processed by the ComServer_CL in maximum 15 ms.
SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1327
ComServer_CL shall provide updated signals latest 20 ms after their corresponding service-based request has been received by CRoute.

sect1.title: Software Unit Interaction

listitem.para: ComServer subcomponent calls ComServer_Serialization subcomponent when one of the corresponding signal of the offered service is changed or a request is received or there is a new subscriber.
ComServer_Serialization subcomponent calls ComServer subcomponent when notification is received and property is valid or a notification is received and property is not valid.

sect1.para: The SoftwareUnitInteraction Diagram shows how the units communicates with each other SoftwareUnitInteraction Diagram

sect1.title: Dynamic Behavior - ComServer
sect1.para: The dynamic behavior of ComServer subcomponent can be seen on the ComServer Interdependencies diagram.

SchM_ICAS1_Main_C0 The subcomponent ComServer is called every 10ms from: SchM_ICAS1_Main_C0 SchM_ICAS1_Main_C0 task used by the Core0 sub-scheduler to execute the cyclic functions of applications placed on Core0. This is an extended task, scheduled by an alarm, triggering an event. (period = 5ms) Must have the highest priority of all OsTasks from this core because ASIL functions are scheduled from here. The execution is protected by External Watchdog and the applications by the S-MPU and C-MPU. Note that the stack size is 10kB to have enough reserve for worst case. The main functions from some 3rd party libraries are also scheduled from this OsTask, worst case stack consumption is unknown. This task accounts for average 22% CPU load on Core0. Max. allowed Jitter +/- 1% for 5ms task it means +/- 50 micro seconds. This task is started from Task_SWP_Init. From SchM_ICAS1_Main_C0 (period = 10ms) the ComServer (QM) functionality is scheduled:
ComServ_Main()
OsTaskActivation: 1 OsTaskAutostart: False OsTaskPriority: 210 OsStacksize: 10000 OsTaskResourceRef: None OsTaskSchedule: FULL Type: Extended Task
No interrupt needs to be configured.
No OS event needs to be configured.
Not applicable.
Not applicable.
ComServer will verify if the reading of RTE signals was made successfully (positive reponse).
Syncronization is assured by task prioritization. No special handling needed.

Brief description
Cyclic function called at 10 ms, initiates a notification sending for the <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName> if it has a subscriber and at least one signal has changed since the last call of this function.
reentrant No context task context thread safe yes multicore safe No. synchronous - yes
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
If service is already offered then this function is called.
if the specific signal is changed between two calls of this function then the latest state of the signal is saved and the <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_send_counter will be set in order to be sent a notification about it for the subscribers.
N/A.
N/A.

Globals
[inout] <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_send_counter
for every signal in a <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>: [inout] <MethodName>_<ShortPropertyType>_<SignalName>_<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_prev [in] <MethodName>_<SignalName>_<ShortPropertyType>
for every different PDU in the <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>: [inout] <BusName>_<MessageName>_for_<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_o<ObjectNumber> _received_prev [in] <BusName>_<MessageName>_for_<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_o<ObjectNumber> _received
for every string in the <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>: [inout] <MethodName>_<ShortPropertyType>_<SignalName>_<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_prev [in] <MethodName>_<SignalName>_<ShortPropertyType> Call Sequence
check_ServiceName_ResourceGroupName_signalChange

Test Method
Unit test is not required as covered by full code review.
Traceability
this function satisfied following DOORS Requirements or Design Decision: SWR_L3_CRoute_Comserv_1001, SWR_ICAS1_GW_3786, SWR_ICAS1_GW_3787, SWR_ICAS1_GW_3751.
static void update_<ServiceName>_signals(void)

Brief description
Cyclic function called at 10 ms, updates all variables which hold signals for the service <ServiceName>. Details
As soon as a signal is received, the received-status-variable of the associated service-object will be set to true.

reentrant No context task context thread safe yes multicore safe No. synchronous - yes
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
If service is already offered then this function is called.

Global variables of the <ServiceName> are set accordingly.
None
None

Globals
[inout] <BusName>_<MessageName>_for_<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_o<ObjectNumber>_received [inout] <ServiceName>_<EventGroupName>_object_<ObjectNumber>_received
IF calculation method: signalValue [out] value_<SignalName>_<ShortPropertyType>
IF calculation method: mappedValue [out] mappedValue_<SignalName>_<ShortPropertyType>
IF calculation method: valueType [out] valueType_<SignalName>_<ShortPropertyType> Call Sequence
update_ServiceName_signals

void ComSer_<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_EventRequested(void)

Brief description
It is a callback function: Enables the subscription for the resource <ResourceGroupName> of the service <ServiceName>
reentrant No context task context thread safe yes multicore safe No. synchronous - yes
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
It is called in case of the first subscriber of the <ResourceGroupName> of the service <ServiceName> on a specific VLAN.
<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_hasSubscription global variable will be increased by one.

N/A.
N/A.

Globals
[inout] <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_hasSubscription
IF the <ServiceName> is not in the extraInitialNotification.txt then [inout] <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_send_counter

Test Method

this function satisfied following DOORS Requirements or Design Decision: {It is a helper function}.
void ComSer_<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_InitialNotificationRequested(void)

Brief description
It is a callback function: Initiates an initial notification for the resource <ResourceGroupName> of the service <ServiceName>.

reentrant No context task context thread safe yes multicore safe No. synchronous - yes
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
It is called if there is a new subscriber of the <ResourceGroupName> of the service <ServiceName> on a specific VLAN and the <ServiceName> is in the "extraInitialNotification.txt".
<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_InitialNotificationRequested global variable will be set to 1u. <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_send_counter global variable will be set to 6u.

N/A.
N/A.

Globals
[inout] <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>InitialNotificationRequested [inout] <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_send_counter

Test Method
Unit test is not required as covered by full code review. Traceability
this function satisfied following DOORS Requirements or Design Decision: {It is a helper function}.
void ComSer_<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_EventReleased(void)

Brief description
It is a callback function: Stops the subscription for the resource <ResourceGroupName> of the service <ServiceName>.

reentrant No context task context thread safe yes multicore safe No. synchronous - yes
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
It is called if the last subscriber of the <ResourceGroupName> of the service <ServiceName> on a specific VLAN is unsubscribed.
<ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_hasSubscription global variable will be reduced by 1.

If the function is called because of the last subscriber then the global variables: <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_send_counter and <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_InitialNotificationRequested will be set to 0u and FALSE respectively. It means that no more notification will be sent for the <ResourceGroupName> of the <ServiceName>.

N/A.
N/A.

Globals
[inout] <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_hasSubscription [out] <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_send_counter [out] <ServiceName>_<ResourceGroupName>_InitialNotificationRequested Call Sequence

reentrant No context task context thread safe yes multicore safe No. synchronous - yes

reentrant No context task context thread safe yes multicore safe No. synchronous - yes
Security Relevance
Security-Relevant. Reason: The services (provided / required) implemented by the ComServer_CL and the rules for service-to-signal signal-to-service transformation needs to be static according with [ComServSpec] and [SST]. This means that it should NOT be possible to be changed during run-time.
This function is called by ComServ_cyclic.

Needed services will be requested

sect1.title: Dynamic Behavior - ComServer_Serialization
sect1.para: The dynamic behavior of ComServer_Serialization subcomponent can be seen on the ComServer_Serialization Interdependencies diagram.
There is no Task in terms of ComServer_Serialization subcomponent. Interrupts
No interrupt needs to be configured.
No OS event needs to be configured.
Not applicable.
Not applicable.

During serialization Comserver will check if the RTE reading is finished correclty. In case the RTE read returns an error (return code different then RTE_E_OK) the signal will not be serialized into the notification/response payload.
Syncronization is assured by task prioritization. No special handling needed.

sect1.title: Data flow Diagram
sect1.para: The diagrams below presents the major dataflow from the module. The Data Flow is described in 2 diagrams for both types of services that are implemented in ComServer : Server and Client.
The first one is for data flow from ComserverQM Server perspective. The second one is for data flow from ComserverQM Client perspective.

entry.para: Comserver is depending on many custom ICAS1 components.
Number of dependencies from interfaces and dependencies equals 4. See External Interfaces and Dependencies.
A failure in this component can impact other functionalities which can be recognized by driver/ passenger, causing strong annoyance and it is an Communication Stack component.
due to algorithms used for deserialization and serialization of the data and big number of services that it implements.
generic code is used for all the services which lowers the risks for inconsistencies and mallfunctions in services implementation.

Input and outputs of this component can be manipulated/seen at system level. There are few requirements that needs to be tested at software level. Interaction of this component with the other components in the programable unit is assured by automated interface testing(RTE interfaces).
